alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lee; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 4:30PM EDT until May 19 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL OWSLEY...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON AND SOUTHERN LEE COUNTIES... At 429 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mummie, or near McKee, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Elian around 435 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Green Hall and Sturgeon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
